intro: Oxyspora serrata, commonly known as the serrated oxyspora, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant is characterized by its finely serrated leaves and small, clustered flowers that typically bloom in the spring. Oxyspora serrata is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest in both horticultural and ecological studies.
